title: Megan McKenna would ‘faint on stage’ if she won X Factor Celebrity
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Megan McKenna might be wowing the judges and the public alike on X Factor: Celebrity, but she admits it’s nice to finally be acknowledged for her singing talents.

The former The Only Way Is Essex star, 27, has been working to crack the music industry for the past two years but has found it hard to be taken seriously as a singer rather than a reality star.

She told Metro.co.uk about how much the positive reaction from the public means to her since she joined X Factor, on the red carpet at the Pride Of Britain Awards on Monday.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Megan gushed: ‘It’s been overwhelming, you know? I can’t get over how many amazing messages I’ve been getting. It’s just a dream come true, you know.

‘I just feel like finally people are taking my music seriously and I’ve been doing this for so long, and I just need a break and I feel like I’m getting it.’

She admitted that she joined the show in the hopes that it would be a platform to make the transition into singing full time.

‘Yeah 100 per cent, I feel like I’ve been trying to crack the music industry now for a long time and it’s been hard crossing over from reality to doing music.

Sorry, this video isn't available any more.

‘But this is the perfect show for me and I can’t thank the public and the judges enough for giving me this chance’, she said.

When asked what she would do if she were to win the show, Megan admitted that the excitement may be too much to bear – and we could see our first fainter on the show.

She joked: ‘Oh don’t, if I won it would mean everything. I don’t even know what I’d do, I’d faint! You’d see the first fainter on X Factor!’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Someone make sure there’s a doctor on call, just in case…

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.

description: Megan McKenna revealed her struggles to be taken seriously as a singer before X Factor: Celebrity after her reality TV past.
